title: LOL Wolrd Map (Upgraded!!)
body:
Hello, guys.
3 months ago, I posted a fan-made map by me , but then I realised that it was not perfect or accurate.

Old one:

https://i.imgur.com/cwrzRNo.jpg

Therefore, I modyfied some parts to present it better.


Two main changes:

1. Ionia should be smaller.(changed)

2. Southern Continent should be bigger, as a continent full of anciente civilizations, such as Targon, Shurima, Icathia.

Take a look.

Entire Map: 
https://i.imgur.com/0QzBxY3.jpg

Southern Continent (modifed): 

https://i.imgur.com/jRKchM1.jpg

BTW, if you want an original map with 37M, I can send you in email.

And, I add " Unknown Lands extending toward the south" for more mysterious spaces


Icathia is actually beside the sea,according to the new lore.

In addition, I modified the south freljord

Hope rioters can make comments for more information, hahahahahahah.. XD{{sticker:katarina-love}}

replies.body:
And queue Bio in..

3...

2...

1...

> [{quoted}](name=Paleo Electro,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-04-02T17:19:05.890+0000)
>
> And queue Bio in..
> 
> 3...
> 
> 2...
> 
> 1...

Sorry I'm late!  Did someone say map!?
Whats with Kumungu. Will we see a story about it? Or do you plan to remove it and rewrite anything that exists about it right now?

I've mentioned before, there is absolutely a large, fantastically ferocious and dangerous, jungle where some champs call home.
What I've not said before is that I doubt we'll be keeping the name.  But a rose by any other name will bite your face off just the same.

This sounds rather interesting to me.
I mean Ivern does mention the kumungu jungles,so I guess a region called kumungu does exist somewhere,it just wouldn't be the home of the jungle champs that you are talking about.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenLore,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=00000000000000000002,timestamp=2018-04-04T11:23:25.489+0000)
>
> This sounds rather interesting to me.
> I mean Ivern does mention the kumungu jungles,so I guess a region called kumungu does exist somewhere,it just wouldn't be the home of the jungle champs that you are talking about.

Well, not to be too slippery about this, but he mentions the "Kumungu Affair" which could mean a current region, could mean it _was_ a region (Ivern is quite old after all), or could mean another sort of place or a person even (if it gave its name to the Kumungu Affair).

Personally I think Kumungu should remain a region. Not only does the name fit but I love seeing regions that are briefly touched in the waaay past be developed and see how they become a part of Valoran. I personally loved how mt. Targon and Bilgewater were elaborated on as they were regions that we knew nothing about previously during the old lore.

Please keep the same name.

> [{quoted}](name=ShadowParker,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=0000000000000000000200000000,timestamp=2018-04-04T17:15:25.025+0000)
>
> Personally I think Kumungu should remain a region. Not only does the name fit but I love seeing regions that are briefly touched in the waaay past be developed and see how they become a part of Valoran. I personally loved how mt. Targon and Bilgewater were elaborated on as they were regions that we knew nothing about previously during the old lore.
> 
> Please keep the same name.

Keeping the name isn't up to me, and I'd not hold out much hope for it.  The coastal settlement (visible on the Medarda Heirloom) called Kumangra was my hat tip to the Kumungu name.  Close enough to be related, but different enough to hopefully not hit the same issues.

What issues are those?

Is there some undesirable translation that cropped up somewhere or something?

> [{quoted}](name=ShadowParker,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=0000000000000000000200000000,timestamp=2018-04-04T17:15:25.025+0000)
>
> Personally I think Kumungu should remain a region. Not only does the name fit but I love seeing regions that are briefly touched in the waaay past be developed and see how they become a part of Valoran. I personally loved how mt. Targon and Bilgewater were elaborated on as they were regions that we knew nothing about previously during the old lore.
> 
> Please keep the same name.

I think merging Kumungu and Plague Jungles into one region called Kumungu would be better. Kumungu being a tropical Amazon like region.

"some champs" you mean Zyra. the most unknown about champ. Please lore update her ;; although i always assumed she was closer to Ionia since magic plants and spirits and whatnot. Specially after the Ionia update she shoudl be a vengeful spirit of a plant or something wanting revenge.
What is the current schedule? Like what comes after Ionia until we get the large, fantastically ferocious and dangerous jungle lore update?

Hello again, My Fizz no ult!  Lovely map work as always :D

(The seasonal attack of the Black Mist from the Shadow Isles, on to Bilgewater is called "The Harrowing" in English, by the way.  Though I do think that Soul Eating Night is a great name too :D)

I'm fascinated by the changes you've made between the two versions of your map.  I see that Ionia has been made smaller, and the jungle areas and the Shuriman and Icathian areas have been separated by a mountain range.  Do you have any reasons why you made those changes, or did they just feel more right to you?

Also, the addition of the Unknown Lands is interesting.  Always good to have room to expand, of course, but I'm sure I won't be the only player wondering what you imagine might be down there.  New nations?  Champions?  What do you think? :)

Beautiful work though.  I'm still looking forward to your reaction when we finally get the Riot version out there.

> Beautiful work though. I'm still looking forward to your reaction when we finally get the Riot version out there.

Is this after we've colonized Mars, or when we finally get hoverboards?
Hover boards are already real.
Hey I'd work for a hoverboard as payment. That would be sweet!

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-04-02T18:15:14.703+0000)
>
> Hello again, My Fizz no ult!  Lovely map work as always :D
> 
> (The seasonal attack of the Black Mist from the Shadow Isles, on to Bilgewater is called "The Harrowing" in English, by the way.  Though I do think that Soul Eating Night is a great name too :D)
> 
> I'm fascinated by the changes you've made between the two versions of your map.  I see that Ionia has been made smaller, and the jungle areas and the Shuriman and Icathian areas have been separated by a mountain range.  Do you have any reasons why you made those changes, or did they just feel more right to you?
> 
> Also, the addition of the Unknown Lands is interesting.  Always good to have room to expand, of course, but I'm sure I won't be the only player wondering what you imagine might be down there.  New nations?  Champions?  What do you think? :)
> 
> Beautiful work though.  I'm still looking forward to your reaction when we finally get the Riot version out there.

From someone who said to me 3 months before that Ionia should be smaller and southern land should be bigger. He is not rioter but he does work related to LOL, so I believe that he knows something. 


I put mountain to separate shurima and icathia because an ancient kingdom that keep itself independent and unique for long time must have some natural advantages to accomplish it. Besides, for such a large area non-mountain seems not reasonable.

The whole southern continent is based on some simple geographic knowledge, like the distribution of tropical, desert, prairie etc. That mountain is from the lore of Bandle city, saying "nobody knows where are yordles, someone say they are hiding in the southeast mountain". So, there is definitely a mountain.

In the unknown regions there may be primitive lost tribes, human or non-human ,or more human-like creatures. Dangerous areas like jungles, deserts, and some other existings we can never imagine. Even some lost civilization wastes, or ruines of big old civilizations like targon.

Speaking of targon, I am always interested by them. Targon is absolutely a big group or nation or civilization or whatever in "pre-history ages" in runeterra.

Since they have already immigrated to the universe and were able to control Aurelian sol,I think they are high civilization not only now but also in past times. Imagine Atlantis , the lost continent in real world.


So, that whole big land, southern continent, including the unknown parts, could all belong to Targons ,where they built empires and civilizations, controlling all the runeterra from the center which lies in southern continent. Mount targon is just a man-made construction , like a tower to connect the runeterra and the space. 

 I hope all that southern lands should be mysterious, legendary, unknown for modern society, and far away from nowadays human civilizations in Valoran. (Since that shurima icathia and Targon mountains, those ancient civilizations are all there). We can build this continent as an ancient enormous lands, much bigger than valoran , making the LOL world more potential, where there are things similar as  ancient Egypt, Sumerian civilizations( the earliest human civilization in real world), and Maya( we can creat America-like things there too).

Such a big continent (or two continents, one of which we can't see yet in the other side of Southern Continent), belongs to the first generation of runeterra ,The Targon, or even Targon is the second generation there was one more!!

This unknown regions along with the known region could be a good place to film documentary like Discover in that world!!m

Btw, what is the progress of world map making?i can't wait ! Ca we see regions map like piltover in advance?


Btw, what about the progress of world making? I can't wait! If we can have some region maps in advance like piltover it would be great!!

one thing that does stick out to me is that the medarda heirloom seems to imply the kumungu jungles are south of piltover, putting them east or northeast of shurima. 

the maps super impressive though.
Isnt shurima south of pultover?
southwest

I only saw this one as an outline!  Wow, color and texture makes this amazing!

Also, my phone can’t get great resolution in this.  Where is Mt. Targon?  I think I see it, but that could be the demacian symbol :/  if someone could give a coastline/general area it’s near that’d be great.

> [{quoted}](name=ZaneShadow,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2018-04-02T22:25:03.611+0000)
>

> 
> Also, my phone can’t get great resolution in this.  Where is Mt. Targon?  I think I see it, but that could be the demacian symbol :/  if someone could give a coastline/general area it’s near that’d be great.

On My Fizz no ult's map, Targon is west of the Shuriman desert, just south of that dip in the coastline where the greenery of the southern  continent almost reaches the northern coast.

> [{quoted}](name=Bioluminescence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2018-04-02T22:44:13.607+0000)
>
> On My Fizz no ult's map, Targon is west of the Shuriman desert, just south of that dip in the coastline where the greenery of the southern  continent almost reaches the northern coast.

Thanks!  Huh, if that’s true Demacians have a ritual pretty far from home!  Taric has quite the treck.
Why did you move Ireland to the east of Great Britain?

> [{quoted}](name=Trias000,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-04-02T19:16:17.039+0000)
>

It just happened to be like britain

Why is there a desert in the northern France? Where's the rest of Europe?!
https://youtu.be/y1il5R7v9cQ?t=4s

I think its kind of interesting where you placed everything. on the OG map everything is on 1 continent and its all crammed up next to each other. Yours gives a much better representation of where things would actually lie. 

3 things bother me about this map though. 

1 Bandle city isnt on it (or im just blind)

2 The proximity of bilgewater to the shadow isles. its really fucking close. Now that could be because you dont wanna make the map gigantic, but i was under the impression it was quite the journey to get there.

3 In the lore isnt Zaun right underneath Piltover. I thought they were vertical. Cause There is the story of how the boy rode essentially an elevator up to Piltover. Now in the OG map Zaun was across the bay, but I think they changed the lore on that.

> [{quoted}](name=rewt127,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2018-04-02T17:33:13.973+0000)

Bandle city is nowhere, nobody knows. 

The proximity between biolgewwater and shadow isles is from the oficial map - Soul eating night (i dont know if in english it is called like this)

 see this https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/2/26/Shadow_Isles_Black_Mist.png/revision/latest?cb=20170219101605


I know zaun and piltover is in the same city, that is why i put there as " Zaun District"
I need the Original on mail .. you did a WoW job <3
{{champion:103}}

2 things. Nami was originally meant to be from the Guardian Sea. Has their tribe been moved, is this mentioned in lore? Or is the Guardian Sea still near the Mount Targon (again mentioned in lore)?

Second, based on the idea that there is 'Unknown Lands', is 'Runeterra' much like Ivalice from FF or Thedas from Dragon Age? Their 'World' is just part of a greater planet, it might not even be the majority.

> [{quoted}](name=Antergaton,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=KsAApOMw,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2018-04-04T12:21:37.072+0000)

> 
> Second, based on the idea that there is 'Unknown Lands', is 'Runeterra' much like Ivalice from FF or Thedas from Dragon Age? Their 'World' is just part of a greater planet, it might not even be the majority.

See nami,s lore

Im not a big fan of the neck part of Valoran where Demacia, Noxus and the Freljord are joined/ divided by the Iron Spike Mountains. I would have assumed that the "neck" would be a lot wider and more expansive. It's just that Noxus holds domain of Iron Spike, as well as parts of south Freljord (although to what extent is undisclosed) and having two different enemies in general focused and condensed around the north of Demacia seems like a weak point that would have been taken advantage.   

Also, I said this last time and was late to respond then as well. The central Noxian landscape is lush green on your map. We all know the environment around there is nothing but arid badlands and dust bowls. Surely the map should convey it with large patches of brown, like Australia from satellite view.
I see skyrim, I upvote

South Unknown lands be like old Earth maps when they did the "Here be dragons" thing cause they didnt knew what was located in that specific area cause they havent explored it yet.

https://steemit-production-imageproxy-thumbnail.s3.amazonaws.com/U5du6R1dg4LakoZaMqa38So3AKavbP2_1680x8400
lol this is super creative
ah so Zaun is at the center of the world .. thats where my mundo grew up .. so the doctor is the center of the world! {{sticker:zombie-nunu-hearts}}

Guess I'm missing something, but shouldn't Targon be on Valoran?
Taric was exiled there, and that story made it look like it was located somewhere on the Demacian-Frelyord border.

Great map btw.

That first island (on the top) looks like the map from Game of thrones lol
There is a really big fish underneath bilgwater...

I have a rather hard request, is it possible to list the source of the names used on the map? there are few of them that i dont remember where they were from like the name of the seas, it would be a good reference for the story as well. to learn where these names were mentioned.

if not then thank you regardless, you did an outstanding job on this!

all from THE FANDOM WIKI and UNIVERSE, and some from the old map. I think most of them you already know, if not, ask me which one you dont know

Oh sorry for missunderstanding i meant which part of the lore they were mention in. for example we know the location of Icathia because of the latest Void update.but i dont remember where the names like the Guardian Sea or Conquerer Sea were mentioned.

oh yeah! i remember now.thank you.
Dude this is sick! Nice work.
Where's Bandle City?
